alert.note: Alert for Snohomish (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 01 at 4:02PM PST until March 03 at 11:16AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Green River Near Auburn affecting King County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Skykomish River Near Gold Bar affecting Snohomish County. Snohomish River At Snohomish affecting Snohomish County. Snohomish River Near Monroe affecting Snohomish County. Snoqualmie River Near Carnation affecting King County. Snoqualmie River Near Snoqualmie Falls affecting King County. .Showers will diminish today and will not contribute to rising river levels. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Snohomish River At Snohomish. * WHEN...Until late Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, the Snohomish River will flood several roads...including the Snohomish-Monroe highway...and low areas of the lower Snohomish valley that are not protected by levees. A stage of 27 feet on the Snohomish River corresponds roughly to a Phase 2 in the Snohomish County flood program. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 26.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:00 PM PST Tuesday was 26.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 27.9 feet late this evening. It will fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 27.9 feet on 02/01/1953. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 1145 PM PST.
